attributes.Long form description: The student begins by changing the joy controllers to the comfort grip, when he finishes the student waits for new instructions. The instructor tells that he need no change the comfort grip to the joycon strap after that the student placed back the joycons on the Nintendo Switch and stand it using the kickstand, then he exchanged de game cartridge and the sd card to finally turn on and off the Nintendo Switch.

attributes.Transcription: We will now operate the Nintendo Switch. The first step is to change the controller from the handheld mode to the joy-con comfort grip.

attributes.Action sentence: The student pulls out the red and blue joy-con controller from the Nintendo switch handheld grip..

attributes.Action Correctness: Wrong Action, corrected by instructor verbally
attributes.Incorrect Action Explanation: The student did not need the comfort grip to take out the joy con controller.

attributes.Transcription: So, you will have to take the colors controllers out

attributes.Action Correctness: Wrong Action, corrected by instructor verbally
attributes.Incorrect Action Explanation: The student had to press a button in order to take out the joy con controller, not by pulling it.

attributes.Transcription: There is a small black button on the back side that you can press and slide the controllers out.
Great.
Now put the color controllers into the comfort grip.

attributes.Action sentence: The student grabs the blue and red joy-con controllers and puts them in the comfort grip.

attributes.Transcription: Put the screen down, and the color parts will go inside the grip.
Great, nice work.
The next step is to change the controllers from the joy-con comfort grip to two joy-cons.
Okay.  I already do that?

attributes.Action sentence: The student properly assembles the blue joy-con controller with the joy-con strap.

attributes.Transcription: So you will take the color controllers out again and now place them in the small joy-cons with the strap.
Okay
Also, slide it from the top.

attributes.Action Correctness: Wrong Action, corrected by instructor verbally
attributes.Incorrect Action Explanation: The student slides the joy con strap upside down.

attributes.Transcription: ThatÂ´s actually upside down, the white button has to be at the bottom.

attributes.Action Correctness: Wrong Action, corrected by instructor verbally
attributes.Incorrect Action Explanation: The student was figuring out how to take off the joy con controller from the joy con strap by pulling it.

attributes.Transcription: You can slide it out again.

attributes.Action Correctness: Wrong Action, corrected by instructor verbally
attributes.Incorrect Action Explanation: The student could not take off the joy con strap, despite the instructor had already explained how to do it.

attributes.Transcription: So the right band you split it in, perhaps you can push down the black part.
I think is stuck.

attributes.Action Correctness: Wrong Action, corrected by instructor verbally
attributes.Incorrect Action Explanation: The student could not slide the joy con strap because it was locked and instead of unlocking, the student was just pulling, over and over again.

attributes.Transcription: So, you have to press the black button and try to slide it out one way or another.
Maybe the lock is locked, so the white lock you can push up.

attributes.Action Correctness: Wrong Action, corrected by instructor verbally
attributes.Incorrect Action Explanation: The student had not locked the joy con controller to the strap.

attributes.Transcription: And then, you can press the lock to lock it.
Great.
Nice work.
Now, please change the controller from the two joy-cons back to the handheld grip.

attributes.Action sentence: The student pulls out the blue joy-con controller from the joy-con strap to move it back into the Nintendo Switch handheld grip.

attributes.Incorrect Action Explanation: The student first had to lock the white button from the blue joy con controller in order to slide the red one.

attributes.Transcription: You here click in place, when you slice it. Okay.

attributes.Action sentence: The student pulls out the red joy-con controller from the joy-con strap to move it back into the Nintendo Switch handheld grip.

attributes.Action Correctness: Wrong Action, corrected by instructor verbally
attributes.Incorrect Action Explanation: The student had to unlock the white button to slide the red joy con cotroller.

attributes.Transcription: They, unlocked again.
Nice work.
Now the next step is to stand the Nintendo using the kickstand.

attributes.Action sentence: The student clicks on the right kickstand lock to stand up the Nintendo Switch.

attributes.Transcription: The kickstand is on the back, on the right hand side.
Nice.
Now please change the game card.

attributes.Action sentence: The student exchanges the old game card with a new one.

attributes.Transcription: Great.
Now please change the micro SD card.

attributes.Action sentence: The student exchanges the old micro sd card with a new one.

attributes.Transcription: The micro SD card is located under the kickstand.  So, you need to open the kickstand and press it to remove it.
Great.
Next please turn on the Nintendo Switch.

attributes.Action sentence: The student presses the left top button to turn on and off the Nintendo Switch.

attributes.Transcription: The power button is located on the top, left hand side.
Great.
Now please turn it off.
The second button, power option.
Great.
You can now press stop on the recording.
